column2: Our client, a social-sector advisory firm, is looking to engage with a Circular Economy Consultant. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in sustainability, waste management, and circular economy principles. They will play a pivotal role in advising clients on the implementation of circularity strategies, facilitating the transition towards a more resource-efficient and sustainable future. Demonstrated project management expertise, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage timelines, and deliver results under pressure. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and other relevant software applications. column2: The climate change and migration research specialist will be part of an interdisciplinary team of researchers working on climate change and migration, and responsible for anchoring field engagements in Odisha      As part of the team, the incumbent s involvement will include planning and execution of fieldwork that comprises qualitative and quantitative methods with a focus on climate-induced migrations and immobility      S/he will conduct household and key informant interviews, organise workshops and stakeholder engagement activities, and build local networks      The role requires working closely with local partner/s in Odisha to coordinate field tasks                      Activities and Tasks          Assisting with the development and implementation of research tools and instruments;      Contributing towards literature reviews and background research as needed;      Conducting field research activities as assigned, including:      Administering household surveys and conducting semi-structured and in-depth interviews with key stakeholders;      Observing community dynamics, organising group discussions, and facilitating dialogues;      Conducting life history interviews with migrants and non-migrants;      Developing and using creative tools during multi-stakeholder events;          Maintaining detailed field notes and records of research activities; transcribing interviews;      Preparing data for analysis by cleaning, coding, and entering information into spreadsheets;      Travelling to research sites within India and adhering to safety protocols;      Conducting oneself professionally and respectfully with all research participants and stakeholders;      Maintaining confidentiality of collected data and adhering to research ethics guidelines;      Collaborating with the IIHS Media Lab and Word Lab teams to ensure effective data collection and evidence building; create audio-visual content and develop material for wider dissemination; support website development and website updates;      Providing support in identifying the need for, and organising, workshops and stakeholder consultations at multiple locations in India;      Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations, and institution building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within the country as and when needed.              Structure and Reporting        The climate change and migration research specialist will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Research Consultant - Practice at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and network partners.            Person Specification        An ideal candidate should have:        A Master s degree in social work, social science, development studies, rural development, environmental studies, or related discipline;      Experience in conducting qualitative and/or participatory data collection (e.g., focus group discussions) and administering quantitative household surveys;      Previous experience in working on migration and with migrant communities;      Familiarity with the Odisha state and its migratory trends, including its socio-cultural and political landscape;      Language proficiency in: Odiya, Bengali.
